title: Roman Abramovich advised not to repeat Kevin De Bruyne mistake with Chelsea star
text:
Roman Abramovich has been urged to avoid selling Mason Mount (Getty Images)

Roman Abramovich’s trusted adviser Piet de Visser told Chelsea’s owner to keep Mason Mount at all costs, according to reports.

De Visser has worked as a scout for Chelsea since 2005 and has been involved in several one-on-one meetings with Abramovich to discuss potential transfers.

The Dutch scout played an integral role in bringing Kevin De Bruyne to Chelsea in 2012 and was upset when the club decided to sell the Belgian during Jose Mourinho‘s reign in 2014.

De Visser even made a personal intervention to keep De Bruyne at Stamford Bridge as he pleaded directly to Mourinho but Chelsea ended up allowing the midfielder to join Wolfsburg for £18 million.

Mason Mount has impressed for Chelsea this season (Getty Images)

Advertisement

Advertisement

According to The Athletic, De Visser was keen to avoid a similar error and alerted Abramovich to Mount’s performances during his loan spell at Vitesse Arnhem in the 2017-18 campaign.

And the 85-year-old is said to have told Abramovich to avoid repeating the same mistake he made with De Bruyne by selling Mount before he was given the chance to impress in the first team.

After spending last season on loan at Derby County, Mount has made an instant impact under Frank Lampard at Chelsea this season.

Piet de Visser (left) attended Chelsea’s clash against Ajax last week (Getty Images)

The 20-year-old has already scored four goals and registered two assists in 14 appearances this term.

De Visser, meanwhile, attended Chelsea’s Champions League clash against Ajax in Amsterdam last week.
